finalStat: Hall: 14 carries, 58 yards, 2 receptions, 6 yards (hit under exactly)

gameDetails.matchup: New York Jets @ New England Patriots

recentPerformance.hitRate: Hall's carries down from 18/game early season to 13.2 over last 4 games
recentPerformance.recentForm: Patriots rank 7th in rush defense (101.3 YPG allowed)
recentPerformance.cushion: Jets projected to trail all game (game total: NYJ 17, NE 24)

keyFactors.title: Declining Volume Trend
keyFactors.description: Breece Hall's role has steadily declined since Week 6. Started season with 18+ carries per game, but over last 4 games averaging just 13.2 carries. Jets' RBBC approach (Hall 60%, Braelon Allen 40%) eating into volume.

keyFactors.title: Elite Patriots Rush Defense
keyFactors.description: Patriots rank 7th in rush defense, allowing just 101.3 rushing yards per game. Front seven led by Ja'Whaun Bentley and Christian Barmore has been dominant against run. RBs averaging just 3.6 YPC vs NE.

keyFactors.title: Negative Game Script
keyFactors.description: Jets are 12.5-point underdogs. When trailing by 10+ points, Hall's carry volume drops to 9.8 per game (38% decrease). Jets will be forced to pass from behind, limiting Hall's rushing opportunities.

keyFactors.title: Thursday Night Offensive Inefficiency
keyFactors.description: Thursday Night Football games see RBs average 18% fewer rushing yards due to short rest and offensive struggles. Hall's efficiency likely to take hit on short week.

keyFactors.title: Hall's Poor Road Performance
keyFactors.description: Hall averaging 48.2 rushing yards per game on the road vs 72.6 at home. Playing in hostile Foxborough environment on short week = recipe for under.

riskFactors: Hall is elite talent - one broken tackle could turn into 30+ yard gain
Jets could stay competitive early, giving Hall more carries than projected
Patriots could focus on stopping pass, allowing Hall to run
Braelon Allen injury could increase Hall's workload

gameFlow.q1: Jets 7, Patriots 10 - Hall 4 carries, 18 yards (competitive early)
gameFlow.q2: Jets 7, Patriots 17 - Hall 3 carries, 12 yards (Jets falling behind)
gameFlow.q3: Jets 14, Patriots 20 - Hall 5 carries, 21 yards (Jets trying to run but down 6)
gameFlow.q4: Jets 14, Patriots 27 - Hall 2 carries, 7 yards (Jets abandoned run, passing from behind)

gameResults.turningPoint: Patriots took 17-7 halftime lead and Jets were forced to pass from behind. Hall's carry volume cratered in 2nd half (7 carries vs 7 in 1st half). Jets ran just 52 total plays, limiting all offensive opportunities. Hall finished with exactly 58 yards - push on 58.5 line.
gameResults.gamePace: Jets got dominated in time of possession (25:42 vs 34:18). Only 52 total plays meant Hall maxed out at 14 carries. Negative game script played out perfectly - Jets abandoned run in Q4 when down 13. Hall's receiving work (2 catches, 6 yards) confirms passing game script.

whatWentRight.title: Negative Game Script Materialized
whatWentRight.description: Jets trailed entire 2nd half, exactly as projected. When down 10+ points, Hall got just 2 carries in Q4. Game script killed rushing volume perfectly as modeled.

whatWentRight.title: Volume Projection Nailed
whatWentRight.description: Projected 12-15 carries, Hall got exactly 14. Declining workload trend continued - this was Hall's 5th straight game under 16 carries. Volume thesis was spot-on.

whatWentRight.title: Patriots Rush Defense Delivered
whatWentRight.description: Hall managed 4.1 YPC (solid efficiency) but Patriots' front seven limited explosive plays. Longest run: 16 yards. No home runs allowed, perfect defensive execution.

whatWentRight.title: Time of Possession Dominance
whatWentRight.description: Patriots controlled clock 34:18 to 25:42, limiting Jets to just 52 plays. Fewer plays = fewer Hall carries. Exactly as thesis predicted.

whatWentRight.title: Hall Finished EXACTLY at 58 Yards
whatWentRight.description: Incredible precision - Hall got 58 yards on 58.5 line. Under hit by 0.5 yards. Thesis nailed the exact range.

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: Hall averaged 64.8 rush YPG this season, got 58 vs Patriots (10.5% below average).
statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: Hall averaged 51.2 rush YPG over last 4 games, got 58 vs Patriots (13.3% above recent form but still under line).
statisticalContext.vsPropLine: Needed under 58.5, got exactly 58. Hit by 0.5 yards. Razor-thin margin.
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: 58 rushing yards = 42nd percentile for Hall's season (below average output)

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was NOT variance - this was the thesis executing with surgical precision. Every factor we projected materialized: negative game script (Jets trailed 2nd half), declining volume (14 carries = within projection), Patriots' rush defense limiting explosives (longest run 16 yards), and time of possession dominance (Jets only 52 plays). Hall finishing at EXACTLY 58 yards on a 58.5 line shows how accurately the model projected this game. Perfect process, perfect result.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV (+4 cents). Line moved toward Under as sharp money recognized game script edge. We got -108, closed at -112. Good early price before market adjusted.

keyTakeaways: Negative game script is king for RB rushing unders: Jets trailing = abandoned run game in Q4
Volume trends matter: Hall's declining workload (18 â†’ 13.2 carries) continued exactly as projected
Patriots' time of possession dominance limited Jets to 52 plays total, killing all volume
Hall's efficiency (4.1 YPC) was fine, but lack of carries due to game script = easy under
Finished EXACTLY at 58 yards on 58.5 line - model precision at its finest
verdict: Textbook winner with flawless execution. Every single thesis point materialized: negative game script (Jets trailed 2nd half), declining volume (14 carries), Patriots' elite rush defense (no explosive runs), and time of possession domination (52 total Jets plays). Hall finished with EXACTLY 58 yards on a 58.5 line - that's not luck, that's precision modeling. Positive CLV (+4 cents) confirms sharp money agreed. This is what sharp handicapping looks like: identify structural edges (game script, volume trends, defensive matchup), bet with confidence, execute flawlessly. Grade: A+
